I noticed there were some questions about whether PRO level historical data is handled by the library a while back and I just wanted to point out that I think there may be issues with how the library handles traded volume given <https://support.developer.betfair.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002401937-How-is-traded-volume-represented-within-the-PRO-Historical-Data-files->.

attachments.title: How is traded volume represented within the PRO Historical Data files?
attachments.text: For a single price point ‘tv’ is cumulative, so each “trd” update contains the price and cumulative traded volume traded so far at that price. See example below: {"op":"mcm",&qu...
attachments.fallback: Betfair Developer Program: How is traded volume represented within the PRO Historical Data files?

elements.text: I noticed there were some questions about whether PRO level historical data is handled by the library a while back and I just wanted to point out that I think there may be issues with how the library handles traded volume given

text: the issues being?

Instead of each `tv` update replacing the previous value, it is the cumulative `tv` at only the prices listed in that particular update. So instead of a monotonically increasing value of `tv`, it jumps around. This is different than the ADVANCED data that follows how things are done with the realtime stream.

elements.text: update replacing the previous value, it is the cumulative
at only the prices listed in that particular update. So instead of a monotonically increasing value of
, it jumps around. This is different than the ADVANCED data that follows how things are done with the realtime stream.

text: if you wanted the cumulative `tv` at all prices, then you need to update the cumulative at particular prices and then sum across prices.

elements.text: at all prices, then you need to update the cumulative at particular prices and then sum across prices.

text: I see, fix would be to += rather than replace in the cache but I and many collect their own data direct from the stream where it isn't cumulative. For those using the ADVANCED data (not sure why you would waste your money on it) you will need to create a custom listener/cache

elements.text: I see, fix would be to += rather than replace in the cache but I and many collect their own data direct from the stream where it isn't cumulative. For those using the ADVANCED data (not sure why you would waste your money on it) you will need to create a custom listener/cache

text: ADVANCED follows the same convention as the stream. It's the PRO data that breaks with the convention

elements.text: ADVANCED follows the same convention as the stream. It's the PRO data that breaks with the convention

text: Also it wouldn't be as simple as using `+=` rather than replace since it is reported for a particular price. You would need to keep track of all of the prices and then sum across them to get the equivalent total matched on runner.

elements.text: Also it wouldn't be as simple as using
rather than replace since it is reported for a particular price. You would need to keep track of all of the prices and then sum across them to get the equivalent total matched on runner.
